originalText.plaidHtml:
Perfection in every scene, absolute cinema. It's refreshing to see such movies produced in Bollywood, I have lost all hope in Bollywood. Perfection in every scene, absolute cinema. It's refreshing to see such movies produced in Bollywood, I have lost all hope in Bollywood.

Perfection in every scene, absolute cinema. It's refreshing to see such movies produced in Bollywood, I have lost all hope in Bollywood.

summary.originalText: Akshaye Khanna Is the Soul of Dhurandhar

originalText.plaidHtml:
I watched Dhurandhar only because of Akshaye Khanna, and honestly he is the BEST thing about the film. I don't know what he's doing or how he does it, but he completely blows the screen away every single time he appears. Even when he's sharing the frame with big actors, your eyes automatically go only to Akshaye. His presence, his expressions, his vibe - he's magnetic. Even when he is not speaking, he's still acting and holding your full attention. We truly need more actors like him in Bollywood.

The movie itself is strong - great performances and very solid character writing. The story could have been a little better, but overall it's a powerful, engaging watch. For me, the absolute highlight is Akshaye Khanna. He lifts the entire film to another level.

9/10 - Watch it for Akshaye Khanna's brilliance.

summary.originalText: Master of Convergence between Story, Screenplay and Music.

originalText.plaidHtml: The best ever product in spy-espionage thriller in Indian cinema. Most of the departments excelled in their craft work. Aditya Dhar is surely go to be the next big thing. Shashwat Sachdeva music aligns and elevates every part of the screenplay. Every actor Ranveer Singh, Akshay Khanna, Arjun Rampal, R Madhavan and Sanjay dutt performed brilliantly.

Dhurandhar is a realistic, truth-based and intense film that avoids noise and focuses on raw reality. Direction is sharp and confident. Every scene feels purposeful, with no unnecessary fillers. Strong characters and sharp direction make it powerful. Some may not digest the truth, but that is its strength.

Dhurandhar is a gripping and mature cinematic experience. Khatarnak.

summary.originalText: A Storyline That Soars with Every Scene

originalText.plaidHtml: Every sequence feels meticulously constructed, with tension building organically until it erupts in unforgettable action. The lead's performance is extraordinary, effortlessly blending vulnerability with sheer determination. Action choreography is inventive, visceral, and narratively significant. Each supporting character contributes depth, creating a multi-layered story that is as emotionally compelling as it is thrilling. Cinematography captures both chaos and quiet reflection, enhancing the story's stakes. The screenplay weaves political intrigue and personal drama seamlessly, making every plot twist impactful. The soundtrack amplifies suspense and emotion, adding intensity without distraction. By the final act, the audience is fully immersed in a high-stakes world that is thrilling, intelligent, and memorable.

Action,Cast, background music, choreography,Story,music everything is 10/10, must watch movie. Ranveer Singh did great as main character, Akshay Khanna (as rahman daikait) and Arjun rampal (as major iqbal) looks perfect,You can feel terror from their character. Sanjay dutt (as SP chowdhary aslam) did fabulous job. Must watch movie of 2025.

Go and watch in theatre only. Superb acting by each individuals , superb story line üëè. And if you're a fan of Ranveer Singh üòé, then no further comments needed . There are too much violence in the movie in some sins , and that's making it more engaging. Don't spoil your mood by listening others . Go watch and then you rate it yourself üôÇ

Aditya Dhar has redefined espionage films in Indian cinema. I liked both the teaser and trailer, but after listening to the length of the film, I was shocked that these people are truly making films. But when I saw it, I couldn't believe that I was seeing something like this for the first time in Indian cinema.

I never leave reviews after watching moive but this moive is worth leaving a review
...although it is a 3 to 4 hor moive but not even a single scenes in the moive it's boring every part develops ur interest.... Akshay Khanna and ranveer Singh played there roles to well ..please do watch this moive. But yes some scene would look a bit cruel and eww but moreover the noive is amazing.

summary.originalText: Excellent Direction, Mindblowing Acting, the BGM & Tracks are just Perfect!!!

originalText.plaidHtml:
So far the best movie of 2025. It is a 3hr 32m movie but even for 1 second you won't feel bored or that it is so long. Direction and Casting is mindblowing and every character has played such an impactful role. The tracks and BGM...Ufffffff..... feels like the hollywood raps and hiphop music is nothing... definitely worthy of an "Oscar" movie.

Please note: This is not a promotional comment. I registered new account in IMDb to give this review.

Amazing movie the reality check was a must and this is real cinema. Aditya Dhar you rock. And all the characters played by top actors were phenomenal that's called the real art you guys had the character you hold I thought I was watching the real them. Akshay Khanna's Aura was something else I swear this man is OG.

summary.originalText: Drama That Moves Mountains, Action That Shakes Worlds

originalText.plaidHtml: Dhurandhar redefines action-thriller storytelling in Indian cinema. The lead actor delivers a performance that is intense, layered, and unforgettable, capturing both the external conflicts and inner turmoil of his character. Supporting actors elevate the narrative with their compelling portrayals, making every interaction meaningful. The director exhibits exceptional command over the story, seamlessly integrating moments of tension, strategy, and emotion. The political backdrop is presented with intelligence and care, providing context without overwhelming the plot. The choreography, cinematography, and background music all contribute to a fully immersive experience. Even small gestures and dialogues carry weight, reflecting the director's attention to detail. Dhurandhar proves that strong direction combined with stellar performances can create a cinematic masterpiece that resonates long after the theater lights come up.

Must watch movie, gripping storyline and great acting and action will keep you at the edge of the seat. I never feel bored through whole storyline even movie is 3.5 hrs long. Akshay khanna role was the limelight and Ranveer singh keeps the lights on. Only Ranveer love story in between feels like forced one but that is short and manageable. Must watch if you love drama, acting and action.

Dhurandar is just too good. A breath of fresh air after so many unreal, over-the-top and cringeworthy so-called spy or action thrillers. This one is raw, grounded, brutal and absolutely gripping from start to finish. The intensity never dips, the action feels real, and every scene has weight. The performances are solid, the pacing is tight, and the film actually respects the audience's intelligence. No forced comedy, no unnecessary drama-just a proper, well-crafted, edge-of-the-seat thriller that delivers on every promise. Easily one of the most satisfying and thrilling movies to come out in a long time.

The movie is a banger!!! A must must watch. I got chills seeing the real clips and audios. Amazing work. More such movies should be made. All the actors has done an amazing job. The dialogue delivery, the set, music... Aditya killed it!! Eagerly waiting for part 2 in march. Lord Akshay Khanna, we bow down to you.

summary.originalText: Gripping but excessively long and violent

originalText.plaidHtml:
The movie is certainly gripping and the nationalist plot based on true events makes it even more appealing. It's the performances that mostly carry the show - Ranveer Singh delivers without any overacting, and looks his part. The show stopper is Akshay Khanna who delivers a stunning performance in his typical understated style.

A rare decent Bollywood movie in last few years has meant more hype than deserved but certainly a good watch!

Dhurandhar feels like one of those intense, edge-of-the-seat stories that keeps pulling you in with its raw energy and strong characters. The narrative is gripping, with a serious, grounded tone that makes the action and emotions feel real rather than overdone. What really stands out is how the characters are written - they feel layered, flawed, and human, which makes you care about what happens to them. At times the pacing slows a bit, but overall it's a solid, engaging watch/read that leaves a strong impression and feels more meaningful than just surface-level entertainment.

Dhurandhar is a cinematic knockout that delivers on every front. The casting feels spot-on, with each performance adding weight and authenticity to the narrative. Aditya Dhar's direction is confident and razor-sharp, proving once again that he knows how to craft a truly theatre-worthy experience.

The cinematography elevates the film to another level, capturing both scale and intensity with striking visuals. The action sequences are exceptionally choreographed-raw, impactful, and never overdone-keeping the adrenaline high throughout.

A special mention goes to the music. Shashwat absolutely nailed the remixes, seamlessly blending modern energy with the film's mood, making the soundtrack a major highlight rather than just a background element.

Overall, Dhurandhar isn't just a good film-it's a full-blown banger. Aditya Dhar doesn't just meet expectations; he smashes them, delivering a powerful, immersive cinematic experience that demands to be watched on the big screen.

The brilliance of Dhurandhar lies in its ensemble cast and the director's meticulous guidance. Each actor is given space to shine while maintaining the story's momentum. The lead delivers a performance full of gravitas, balancing power, vulnerability, and intelligence. Supporting characters are equally strong, adding texture to the plot. The director's attention to detail is evident in every sequence-from political strategy discussions to heart-stopping action scenes. Visual storytelling, combined with smart editing, ensures that even complex subplots remain easy to follow. The film's score intensifies emotions at key moments, making the audience feel the stakes. Dhurandhar demonstrates how strong direction and brilliant performances can elevate cinema to an art form.

That movie was totally awesome with insane action sequences! The background music just amplified every single fight scene, making it even more epic. You could feel the intensity through the screen. Seriously, the choreography and the soundtrack were perfectly synced. I was on the edge of my seat the whole time!

Just walked out of the cinema after watching #Dhurandhar, and I'm still processing the sheer scale and intensity of Aditya Dhar's vision. This isn't just a spy thriller; it's a gritty, complex underworld saga that uses the espionage framework to explore the brutal realities of covert operations. The film's strength lies in its refusal to offer easy answers, instead plunging us deep into the perilous world of Lyari, where the lines between criminal, politician, and spy are constantly blurred.

The performances are truly the foundation of this masterpiece. Ranveer Singh as Hamza Ali Mazari delivers a performance defined by restraint and explosive intensity-his transformation from a green operative to a feared figure of authority is a masterclass in controlled acting. But the undeniable show-stealer is Akshaye Khanna as Rehman Dakait. His introduction scene, set to the viral 'FA9LA' track, is one of the most electric cinematic moments of the year. He doesn't shout to exert dominance; he simply is the power, making his character an unforgettable, chilling antagonist.

The film's runtime is long, but Aditya Dhar utilizes every minute to meticulously build the world and its complex politics, a treatment rarely seen in mainstream Bollywood. The technical departments-from the raw, dusty cinematography to the hard-hitting sound design-deserve special mention for creating such an immersive, unsettling atmosphere.

If you're looking for a spectacle with depth, incredible performances, and a story that genuinely grips you until the final, shocking tease for the sequel, Dhurandhar is absolutely essential viewing. Go watch it on the biggest screen possible. It's a bold, brilliant piece of cinema. üáÆüá≥üî• #DhurandharReview #RanveerSingh #AkshayeKhanna #AdityaDhar #MustWatch.

For every Indian, Dhurandhar stands as a must-watch movie that beautifully blends courage, unity and the spirit of freedom. It showcases how ordinary people can achieve the impossible when they stand together with determination. The film's emotional depth and patriotic essence make it unforgettable for all generations.

To prevent future terrorist attacks and to cut the head of the snake off, a man embeds himself in the belly of the underworld to gather intel and commit espionage.

This is a terrific movie mixing different genres into one. The main genres are organized crime, spy, romance, and politics. The story's timeline is built around tragic events, but the story itself is fiction. The story blends the many genres well, switching between them seamlessly. The action is sparse, but well done, with just a bit being over the top. The three-hour and thirty-four-minute runtime flies by and is worth it. This is definitely a movie worth a ticket.

If you haven't watched this movie in theaters, you are missing out on a lot. Worth every penny üî•üî•üî•. Just go and watch without a single thought. Incredible work of each and every actor and team. Aditya Dhar, huge respect, great work. This youth must be aware of the realities. 80% scenes when I didn't blink for minutes.

Wonderful movie and worth the wait! Everyone has done justice to the characters and definitely a grand comeback for Akshaye Khanna. Ranvir Singh has done really well and has shown why he is a good actor other than what he does outside the movie which is annoying (like that mocking Kantara video). However, this movie should be watched for our nameless heroes who have contributed so much for our nation and get unnoticed!!
